title: What happened in the end of The Walking Dead season 9?
text:
The Walking Dead season 9 bid farewell to Andrew Lincoln as Rick Grimes (Picture: AMC)

Prepare to welcome the survivors and the Whisperers back into your living-room as series 10 of The Walking Dead kicks off on Monday night.

The series opener, Lines We Cross, aired in the US on Sunday night and you can see it here on Fox tonight at 9pm.

Except of course it’s been a while since the show was last on our screens – so you might have forgotten where season nine left off.

Need to catch up before you tune in? Take a look below (spoilers, obviously)…

What happened in the end of The Walking Dead season 9?

The ninth season of The Walking Dead was notable for the departure of Andrew Lincoln’s Rick Grimes, the arrival of the Whisperers and that time jump.

Following Andrew Lincoln’s confirmation he was set to leave in series nine – causing the inevitable heartbreak among TWD fans – the character narrowly escaped death after he was impaled and left for dead with walkers closing in.

Rick’s fate was left hanging in the balance but he was rescued by helicopter (Picture: AMC)

He almost met his maker after trying to blow himself and them up, but ultimately left his fate hanging in the balance when he was saved by a helicopter which whisked him away – potentially leaving the door open for a future return.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Meanwhile the Whisperers, led by Alpha (Samantha Morton) became enemy number one – and with the arrival of Gamma (Thora Birch), a newcomer in their ranks, this isn’t likely to end any time soon in season 10.

Alpha brought the Whisperers to season 9 (Picture: AMC)

And let’s not forget that time jump which brought things forward by six years and led to the departure of Maggie (Lauren Cohan) – who we later learned had left camp a year earlier.

Away from all the build-up we bid farewell to season nine with two notable events.

The first of these came in the shape of one of the show’s most brutal episodes ever, with 10 characters falling victim to a massacre at the hands of the Whisperers during the Kingdom fair, and having their heads mounted on pikes.

All this and Negan (Picture: AMC)

Among those who met a grisly end were newfound Hilltop leader Tara (Alanna Masterson) and Carl’s former girlfriend Enid (Katelyn Nacon) as well as Henry (Matt Lintz), Tammy Rose (Brett Butler), Highwayman leader Ozzy (Angus Sampson), Alek (Jason Kirkpatrick and former Savior DJ (Matt Mangum).

The series came to a dramatic end with a storm which saw all the survivors moving to Hilltop – and the return of Negan (Jeffrey Dean Morgan) who saves Judith (Calley Fleming) with things ending on a cliffhanger as a voice came through on the radio asking if anybody was there.

When is The Walking Dead on?

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The series begins on Fox on Monday night at 9pm followed immediately by spin-off series The Talking Dead at 10.05pm.

If you miss any episodes you can catch up with them via Sky’s On Demand service or via NOW TV.

description: The Walking Dead season 10 has kicked off in the US and reaches the UK tonight - here's what happened at the end of the last season.
